column4:
Is the game multiplayer?
The game supports local co-op and online multiplayer, and works well with remote play tools like Steam's Remote Play Together and Parsec.
You can mix and match these, too, so you can do whatever combination works best for your group. You can have two people playing on the same computer, connected with another person running the game on their computer who is sharing it with another friend over Parsec (if you wanted to!)

How much does it cost?
The game will have an SRP of £14.99 / $17.99 / €17.99. For other regions we are using Steam’s regional pricing system. Expect the prices to be close to similar prices games

Can I try before I buy?
Yep – the free Steam demo will remain available.

Can I save mid run? 
Yup! If you quit the game or it crashes during the run, the game will save automatically and you can go back into your game by using the floppy disc in your lobby

Where can I join in with the PlateUp! Community?
If you want to keep up-to-date for changes, you should follow the game on Steam and join our Discord[discord.gg/plateup].

Will you be adding to the game post launch? 
We’re hoping this is very much the start for PlateUp! If the demand is there, we’ll be ready to serve up additional content.

Hey All!

Now we're a little past our launch, I know a few people are finding the odd bug here and there. If you find one of these pesky bugs you can report it to us directly with this handy form.

https://airtable.com/shrWa4fYIlKEDaAlj

Useful information to include on these bug reports are:

- Links to screenshots/videos of the issue
- brief description of what happened leading up to the bug

Thank you for your support,
The Yogscast Games Team

[h1]How to setup Twitch[/h1]
[b]NOTE: Only the host of the multiplayer game should run the Twitch tool. It will work across multiple channels once the host has set it up correctly.[/b]

[h1]Launching the Chef Twitch tool[/h1]
[list][*]Go into the options
[*]Go into Additional Options
[*]Select Open Chef
[/list]

Upon launching chef two additional windows may appear. One being Windows Firewall, please give the Chef tool permission. The other being the Twitch authorisation screen on this screen hit Authorize to connect Twitch.

[h1]Authentication[/h1]
[url=https://imgur.com/t9zeDOW]IMAGE [/url]
If you did not authorize your account with the initial pop up please follow these steps. At the top of the first tab there is a button "Connect Twitch". Once you press this button a webpage will appear instructing you to sign in to Authenticate your account. You will know you account is fully connected if under the Channels section it connects and no longer is showing the spinning circle.

[h1]Streaming with Friends - How to add additional channels[/h1]
Once the host Twitch account is fully connected, simply add the channels name you would like to partake in the integration too using the text box. Be sure to hit Enter after typing the name. You will know the account has been added once the grey circle has stopped spinning and their name is no longer greyed out.
[url=https://imgur.com/sr3iRIz]EXAMPLE[/url]

By setting others channels to be included in the commands, it does mean the host will also send messages in each individual chat telling viewers they can use the commands there too.

[h1]Visitors & Ordering Meals[/h1]
[url=https://imgur.com/uq1JDlx]IMAGE[/url]
By default visiting is set to [b]ON[/b] and available to [b]ALL[/b] viewers. This can be changed at any time. Changing between permissions does not clear the current queue.
The options are:
[list]
[*]Off
[*]All Viewers
[*]Subs Only
[*]VIP Only
[/list]
These can be set individually for both Visitors & Meals.
By allowing visitors the names of the viewers who use the !visit command will appear above the heads of the customer. The !visit command will not be recognised until you begin a game, any commands used whilst the players are in the hub will be ignored. Once a viewer has used !visit they will be in the queue for the entire restaurant run and will not need to use it again until you fail and start a new restaurant.

By allowing visitors to choose their meal an overlay will appear on the screen which will show the viewers which dishes are available to order. These can be ordered anytime up to before arriving at the restaurant. These commands will appear as !order1, !order2, !order3. There will never be more than 3 available orders. If an order is not chosen a random one will be chosen.

[h1]In-Game Tips[/h1]
[url=https://imgur.com/vDtXayA]IMAGE[/url]
[b]THIS IS SET TO OFF BY DEFAULT[/b]
For Streamers who want to add other ways for viewers to interact with the Stream there is the option to turn on in-game tips. This allows viewers to have their bit donations shown in game as a tip after their meal. This can be a fun way to integrate bits into a stream. There is also the option for viewers who have donated bits to skip the queue, this number can be set as high or as low as the streamer wishes. The default for this is 10 bits. The purpose of viewers who have donated to skip the queue is that their bit tips can be seen in game.

If multiple channels are connected, donating bits will work across multiple channels and will be shown regardless of which Twitch chat they were donated in. The bits will solely go the to streamer they were donated to.

[b][u]PLATEUP! DOES NOT HANDLE ANY OF THE BITS DONATED AND ONLY READS THE DONATION IN CHAT. NO BITS ARE GIVEN TO THE GAME NOR THE CREATORS OF THE GAME. ALL BIT DONATIONS ARE TREATED LIKE STANDARD BIT DONATIONS[/u][/b]

[h1]Card Polls[/h1]
[url=https://imgur.com/l7DUWgy]IMAGE[/url]
[b]To use the integrated polls you are required to be at least an affiliate. [/b]
If this setting is set active it will automatically create a Twitch poll using the Poll system anytime the player gets to a card decision. The poll will appear as two competing bars on the screen, there is an additional option which allows the card decision to be decided by the poll automatically. However with this left off the poll will end and the Streamer still has the final decision. A key thing to note here is that if you decide to use the Twitch polls they will only appear on the hosts stream. [b]If you would like the poll to be across all streams read below. [/b]

The duration of the poll can also be set within the Chef tool, the default is 60 seconds however this can be increased/decreased as the Streamer requires.
All standard Twitch Poll systems work as usual, including using channel points/bits to gain additional votes on a poll. The values of how many bits anc channel points can also be customised in the tool too. 

[h1]Text Polls[/h1]
If you are playing with friends and multiple people are streaming at the same time, using text polls are a way to have the same amount of interactivity over multiple streams. When text polls are selected rather than Card Polls, viewers will be able to vote for either card using !a or !b. The visuals for this will be the exact same of the Card Polls except the viewers will be told if they want to vote they have to use chat. All !a or !b commands will be read over all connected channels, so you do not need to worry about one section of viewers missing out!

[h1]Predictions[/h1]
[url=https://imgur.com/l1Rjmjx]IMAGE[/url]
If you like to use predictions as a way of your viewers using their channel points, there is a quick way to have these trigger from within the tool. This part of the Twitch integration will allow you to create predictions on the fly with a single click, allowing you to focus on the game. You can fully customise the prediction text to match your stream theme or language. 
This prediction will not close automatically so, if for any reason something goes wrong, you will still have the authoritative power of the viewers channel points.

Anyone else find certain cards unfun?

I find the cards that slow you down are an instant roadblock to your game when you're forced to choose it as the lesser of two evils. 

The cards such as "You walk slower when customers look at you" are interesting because you can counteract them by changing your restaurant layout / gameplay to stay out of line of sight. 

A blank slate of slowing you down like "you walk slower at the end of the day" is extremely unfun because there's nothing you can do to counter it. Especially when the blueprints are constantly not giving you things to help automate the process, and not giving you trainers to run slightly faster.

I'd enjoy more interesting cards that have counters to them from your restaurant layout and choices of how you play.

column1: Profile gone - poorly designed save system?
column4:
So I have just over 40 hours in this game - and when I opened it today my profile was just 'poof' gone, missing entirely. I had the option to create a new one and that's it.

I see multiple (mostly unanswered) Steam threads about profiles going missing, and one big Reddit thread about how to (try to) fix it using the %appdata% files. 

I tried to delete not just the most recent file from the 'progress' folder but the 2 most recent, while the game was on title screen, and it didn't help. I tried the same thing with the 'profile' folder, didn't help either. Verifying integrity didn't help. I created 2 new dummy accounts just to see what happened with the files - deleting every single new progress & profile file related to these new creations did not delete the profiles from the game... I had to go inside the game to remove them from the bed... and my original profile was still gone.

It was at this point that I realized, even though my profile is gone from the home menu - when I 'created a new one' and went into the home lobby - all my saved restaurants, achievements, and crates on the left hand side are still there... like my progress saved itself somehow even though my profile disappeared.

What gives?

Hi folks!

I tried to play PlateUp! with my three friends couple days ago. What has happened to the net coding? Six months ago everything was totally fine, now the game lags really bad. And it wasn't my connection or the connection of my friends. We all tried hosting, we switched connections... we even tried invites through Steam and straight from the game through the invite code.

We tried to troubleshoot the problem for an hour but we couldn't figure out the problem. Normal solutions (restarting the connections, switching connections, switching the host etc etc.) didn't work. And honestly, it has to be something to do with the game as it was working great on multiplayer six months ago. Has some changes been implemented or..?

Thank you in advance for your answers. Would love to stream the game but this time it was impossible. Single player works just fine.

column1: So in this game if you know you are losing
column4:
QUIT to Headquarters so that game is saved.  The only way to get ahead in this game and save your progress is to perform a preventative QUIT to headquarters in the game.  Sort of stupid, I know, but seems the only way to save what progress you have and try again the same store with a different tack.  

This is especially true if you get into the game and decide your layout is not conducive to efficiency.  An example is having put an ingredient in the corner and the game mechanics make all but impossible to select the corner ingredient.  You have to quit to save and the next launch re-arrange before you let customers arrive.

If you let the game end you day and your game, you will lose all your progress and any saved game to this point.  It is an aspect that I hate, vehemently but unless you do this you cant ever hope to see more of the game.

column1: LF People to play with - US and Canada
column4:
Hi, me and my friend are looking for some people to play PlateUp! 
This is my friend's profile (he goes by kazen). Please refer any inquires to him so he can whine about it to me later : https://steamcommunity.com/id/yesi♥♥♥♥/ (Replace the censored with the f word)

Beginners are welcome, we're just trying to have fun and aren't overly concerned about being the most skilled(cause we aren't either). We are looking for new friends to play other games too so personality is important. We are both leftists who are politically oriented. Conservatives need not apply, must be LGBTQ+ friendly. We have a sense of humor but don't tolerate any un-ironic racism, misogyny, homophobia, etc. 

Availability for me is most days after around 3 PM EST(12 PM PST), but his is usually only after 11 PM EST(8 PM PST). We would typically start playing Monday or Tuesday nights, although I am available most of this week cause I'm off work.

this is mostly just a fun little idea, for a possible game mode\/mod, that me and the s\/o bounced around while playing, and i think would be fun :]\n\nbasically it'd be a buffet mode, wherein you'd have to keep the stock up, instead of serving individuals. also, possible add a bonus thing where you cook special dishes- inspiration was this chinese buffet we were at, that had a mongolian barbecue, wherein you'd (the customer) pick the stuff to go on, and a cook would (obviously) cook it. could also make it so you would have to serve drinks and desserts, and maybe clean out dishes as the customers go. could be fun, i think :]

Do they even work?\n\nNobody will order Cookies so I place one on a Display Stand. I have plenty of customers yet no-one orders any??
Idea for a new menu item?

Would kill for some other modes of giving people food, like delivery pickup drivers, customers waiting in line for their own food, drive-thru, etc. 

-
[b]Delivery Pickup:[/b] Bag food, leave on a surface, "driver" comes to pick up and leave automatically.
[b]Customer Line:[/b] Customers stand at surface, waiting for food. Orders immediately, food served to directly to customer. May ask for bag to leave instead of eating in.
[b]Drive-Thru Window:[/b] Serve food in bag at window on outer edge of restaurant. Lower patience, never seated.
-

I think it'd add a lot of variety to the game while still allowing for the existing mechanics to play into these new types of serving, and could feasibly be added as level components or blueprint items. Been enjoying the game for a long time, but I think the singular method of serving customers is holding back a lot of potential for player expression with restaurant layouts. 

I think a big thing with the game right now is that all customers are expected to come in, sit down, then leave. There's no takeout or customers who pick up their own orders, and being able to combine elements of them together optionally would be really cool. 

We only ever really get to be one type of restaurant and it'd be really nice to see more, especially as we see more and more food (modded or official) that feel better suited to these other real-world variations on food service.

When I host a game for my friends via remote play together, their inputs for controller are messed up. A \"tap\" becomes \"hold\" and a \"hold\" becomes \"tap\". As a result all the controls are very unintuitive. Anyone else got the same issue?

column1: What have you done to the game?
column4: Why is the research desk not dropping for the first 3 days or so, after the first star why do i always have to pick a second dish? I just want to play casually get my 5 stars and i dont want to sweat. I tought this also could be a relaxing game played with your friends, with some spikes of haste or missclicks, and tactical desicions what to buy and how to set up the kitchen. Half the dishes i even dont want to play, like steaks the ``easiest\u00b4\u00b4 tutorial food, is so hard because you have to check what the person wants before u even cook. And its okay if people enjoy this kind of hasty and sweaty play style but as a player i want to have a choice how i play the game. And i also looked briefly in the Workshop, I didnt see any rebalance mods, that work or rebalance the game in a good way. please let the players choose their difficulty to play and dont dictate a play style or a changes to how the game should be played. It isnt an e-sport game, and it is not important how good someone is on a global leaderbord.\nGreetings

So i wanted to make a suggestion to make a game more or less like Plate Up! but instead of food run a hospital, or clinic. There's actually a ton of games you could spin off of Plate Up! but I have been thinking recently when playing that a hospital could be great fun. Getting machines to better diagnose patients, getting the proper things to treat patients, finding ways to handle it in house to get the most money possible. Having to keep things clean to prevent infections and slower diagnostics, testing, and treatments, etc.. \n\nI dunno, just a thought I had. I do wonder if you have thought about spin-off games yet and what they might be and look like. Plate Up! still has a ton of potential to expand and be even better and I know this may not even be on the consideration table from the pile of thoughts and ideas but I just thought I'd toss it out there.

So when I want to play Plateup, I open steam and press play. Once the game loads, I usually click with my mouse to register that any input will be for the game. Then I press the X(A on XBox) to try to play the game with controller. That worked until about 8 hours ago. Currently, when I repeat the steps, instead of playing with the controller as my input, I am redirected to steam where it either prompts me to close the game or review the steam controller layout. I just want to play with my controller.\nP.S. I am using mods but the mods worked before and after and were not changed
just want to work in a full kitchen

I feel like this games only fault is its biggest. There is no server list. In order to play this game effectively and actually have fun you need other players. I see people argue that you can play solo but that's not what makes the game fun.. Finding a group to play with is extremely tedious.

Something Id love to see added is a better way to re-arrange your shop. If we could use the mouse to move things across the board, that would be ideal. if not, maybe we could pick up multiple things to move them. Its just tedious when you have to re-arrange everything and you slooooowly move across the screen to do so, especially for solo when you dont have extra hands

Since using mods (Thanks clever modders \u02d0lunar2019coolpig\u02d0) my play style has changed from the games main play through to a more relaxed controlled game. \n\nI was just wandering how mods may of changed your perspective\/play style??
Curious how the game actually ends?\n\nThanks. \u02d0csd2yay\u02d0

column1: Wrong price when trying to buy the game
column4: The price of this game is advertised as on sale for 75% off, however when trying to purchase the game the discount changes to 45%. Could you please fix this?

I love this game, but Overtime would be so much better if you could buy additional tile space in the restaurant. The run-killer should be your optimization and selections; not running out of space to automate. Allow us to purchase additional space for money, with the price increasing by 10 every purchase like the re-roll. This would make it more of a choice at end game. Reroll for that missing object or add an extra tile to fit in 1 more conveyor. Maybe only offer  the extra space after a certain overtime day or after day 15.

column1: Single serve stuffing makes me angry.
column4:
Why is it five steps for a SINGLE serving of stuffing. No one makes a single serving of stuffing in reality. Let me make an entire pot of stuffing, PLEASE!

Stuffing has been a run killer for me every time it comes up unless I'm lucky enough to get multiple mixers and conveyor belts early int he run which is almost never.

Please, please, please, kill single serving stuffing.

Please.

this used to work fine, but lately it just keeps doing it. Im automating the lattes and have to set up so one smart grabber takes the milk off the grabber while another smart grabber takes the lattes off the grabber and pushes them into a frozen prep station; however, every other time it keeps accepting milk into the latte smart grabber and breaking the automation. is there a way to fix this? It never used to do this and its getting really annoying and i genuinely cant tell if its a bug, a tick error or what\n\nIssue is temporarily fixed by using a rotating grabber and pointing it into nothing. It pulls from the machine but can't send it anywhere, th smart grabbers can then do their thing without the weird bug occurring. Still don't know why its broken or how to fix it without having to do this
